definition: not be without some advantage/be of some help

sentences.english: She has her doubts about loaning him more money.
sentences.chinese: 她对是否再借钱给他不无疑虑。

sentences.english: "Except for one or two minor details," said Aziraphale smugly.
sentences.chinese: “除了一两个小细节，”亚茨拉菲尔不无得意地说。

sentences.english: Toral is also called an Internet “evangelist, ” for good reason.
sentences.chinese: 托拉尔也被称为互联网的“传道者”，这不无道理。

sentences.english: Medical and science community seriously talk about "cushioning" by landing on the heel.
sentences.chinese: 医学和科学组织不无严肃地提及脚后跟着地时的缓冲。

sentences.english: Is such a thing out of the question today?
sentences.chinese: 这种东西对于今天的问题也不无相关。

sentences.english: After fine goods, is not without reason.
Fan Zengxiang's administrative style still has significance and value for our reference today.
sentences.chinese: 樊增祥的施政风格，在今天亦不无借鉴意义和价值。

sentences.english: These exist in the dark about the crisis, Ouyang are not without worries.
sentences.chinese: 谈起这些存在的暗在危机，欧阳不无忧虑。

sentences.english: So ultimately, I would probably side more with Krugman, but there is some sense in what Roach says.
sentences.chinese: 基本上我更支持克鲁格曼，但罗奇的说法也不无道理。

sentences.english: Perhaps that has something to do with the fact that he still works in China.
sentences.chinese: 这大概与他还要继续在中国工作不无关系。

sentences.english: The sergeant nods silently - and not a little proudly.
sentences.chinese: 中士默默又不无骄傲地点点头。

sentences.english: Though he acted rashly, he had some excuse.
sentences.chinese: 他虽然行动卤莽，但亦不无理由。

sentences.english: In private this was sometimes cynically admitted.
sentences.chinese: 这一点有时候私下里不无嘲讽地承认。

sentences.english: It is a fact that many anomie phenomenon in the news circle conflict with the construction of a Harmonious Society today.
sentences.chinese: 新闻业内失范现象泛滥，这与和谐社会建构不无抵牾。

sentences.english: We've taken control every time we've had a chance to, but not without regrets.
sentences.chinese: 我们控制了每一个选择，但是也不无遗憾。

sentences.english: “You have a limited amount of affection to give, ” he said without irony.
sentences.chinese: “你给出的感情总是有限制，”他不无讽刺的说。

definition: not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
lit. to take joy in calamity and delight in disaster (idiom); fig. to rejoice in other people's misfortune/Schadenfreude
to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
